body:
# raudio.cr

:sound: [raudio](https://github.com/raysan5/raudio) - a simple audio library based on miniaudio - for Crystal

## Installation

Add to `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  raudio:
    github: kojix2/raudio.cr
```

Run `shards install`. The native library builds automatically.

## Usage

### Audio device

```crystal
require "raudio"

Raudio::AudioDevice.open do
  Raudio::AudioDevice.master_volume = 0.8
end
```

### Sound playback

```crystal
Raudio::AudioDevice.open do
  sound = Raudio::Sound.load("effect.wav")
  sound.volume = 0.5
  sound.play

  while sound.playing?
    sleep 10.milliseconds
  end
end
```

### Music streaming

```crystal
Raudio::AudioDevice.init

music = Raudio::Music.load("background.mp3")
music.volume = 0.8
music.looping = false  # Disable looping (enabled by default)
music.play

loop do
  music.update
  break unless music.playing?
  sleep 10.milliseconds
end

Raudio::AudioDevice.close
```

### Wave data

```crystal
Raudio::AudioDevice.open do
  wave = Raudio::Wave.load("audio.wav")
  sound = Raudio::Sound.from_wave(wave)
  sound.play
  wave.export("output.wav")
end
```

## Resource Management

Resources should be explicitly released when done, or use the block form for automatic cleanup.

### Recommended patterns:

```crystal
# Block form (automatic cleanup)
Raudio::Sound.load("effect.wav") do |sound|
  sound.play
end

# Manual release
sound = Raudio::Sound.load("effect.wav")
begin
  sound.play
ensure
  sound.release  # or sound.close
end
```

Finalizers are provided as a fallback but explicit cleanup is recommended.

## Supported formats

WAV, OGG, MP3, FLAC, QOA

## API

- `Raudio::AudioDevice` - audio device management
- `Raudio::Sound` - short audio clips
- `Raudio::Music` - streaming audio
- `Raudio::Wave` - raw waveform data
- `Raudio::AudioStream` - custom streaming

Low-level C bindings: `Raudio::LibRaudio`

## Development

```bash
make -C ext        # build native library
crystal spec       # run tests
```

## Examples

See `examples/` directory.

## License

MIT

Dependencies (bundled single-header/native libraries):

- [raudio](https://github.com/raysan5/raudio) (C library) – zlib
  - [miniaudio](https://github.com/mackron/miniaudio) – Public Domain or MIT-0
  - [dr_wav](https://github.com/mackron/dr_libs) – Public Domain or MIT-0
  - [dr_mp3](https://github.com/mackron/dr_libs) – Public Domain or MIT-0
  - [dr_flac](https://github.com/mackron/dr_libs) – Public Domain or MIT-0
  - [stb_vorbis](https://github.com/nothings/stb) – Public Domain or MIT
  - [qoa](https://github.com/phoboslab/qoa) – MIT
  - [jar_xm](https://github.com/kd7tck/jar) – WTFPL v2 – (included in source)
  - [jar_mod](https://github.com/kd7tck/jar) – Public Domain (CC0 1.0) – (included in source)

Summary: Project code is MIT, bundled raudio is zlib, and all other bundled dependencies are permissive (Public Domain/Unlicense, MIT-0, CC0 1.0, WTFPL v2) with no copyleft obligations.

types.name: AudioDevice
types.doc:
Audio device management (singleton pattern)
Handles initialization and cleanup of the audio device

Note: AudioDevice operations are thread-safe, but audio playback
operations (Sound, Music, AudioStream) should be performed from
a single dedicated thread.
types.summary: Audio device management (singleton pattern) Handles initialization and cleanup of the audio device

class_methods.name: close
class_methods.doc:
Close the audio device
This is automatically called at program exit if init was called
Thread-safe: Can be safely called from any thread
class_methods.summary: Close the audio device This is automatically called at program exit if init was called Thread-safe: Can be safely called from any thread

def.name: close
def.body:
@@mutex.synchronize do
  if @@initialized
  else
    return
  end
  LibRaudio.close_audio_device
  @@initialized = false
end

class_methods.name: init
class_methods.doc:
Initialize the audio device
This is automatically called when using the block form
Thread-safe: Can be safely called from any thread
class_methods.summary: Initialize the audio device This is automatically called when using the block form Thread-safe: Can be safely called from any thread

def.name: init
def.body:
@@mutex.synchronize do
  if @@initialized
    return
  end
  LibRaudio.init_audio_device
  @@initialized = true
end
at_exit do close end

class_methods.name: master_volume
class_methods.doc:
Get master volume (listener)
Thread-safe: Can be safely called from any thread
class_methods.summary: Get master volume (listener) Thread-safe: Can be safely called from any thread

class_methods.doc:
Set master volume (listener)
Thread-safe: Can be safely called from any thread
class_methods.summary: Set master volume (listener) Thread-safe: Can be safely called from any thread

class_methods.name: open
class_methods.doc:
Open audio device with automatic cleanup
This is the recommended way to use the audio device
Thread-safe: Can be safely called from any thread

Example:
```
AudioDevice.open do
  # Use audio here
end
```
class_methods.summary: Open audio device with automatic cleanup This is the recommended way to use the audio device Thread-safe: Can be safely called from any thread

def.name: open
def.body:
init
begin
  yield
ensure
  close
end

Thread-safe: Can be safely called from any thread
class_methods.summary: Check if audio device is ready Thread-safe: Can be safely called from any thread

constants.doc: NOOP callback retained to avoid GC (used when clearing callbacks)
constants.summary: NOOP callback retained to avoid GC (used when clearing callbacks)

types.doc:
AudioStream represents a custom audio stream
Use this for procedural audio or custom audio processing
types.summary: AudioStream represents a custom audio stream Use this for procedural audio or custom audio processing

class_methods.doc: Attach audio stream processor to the entire audio pipeline
class_methods.summary: Attach audio stream processor to the entire audio pipeline

class_methods.name: buffer_size_default=
class_methods.doc: Default size for new audio streams

class_methods.name: detach_mixed_processor
class_methods.doc: Detach audio stream processor from the entire audio pipeline
class_methods.summary: Detach audio stream processor from the entire audio pipeline

class_methods.name: ready?
class_methods.doc: Check if audio stream is ready

constructors.name: load
constructors.doc: Load audio stream (to stream raw audio pcm data)
constructors.summary: Load audio stream (to stream raw audio pcm data)
constructors.args_string: (sample_rate : UInt32, sample_size : UInt32, channels : UInt32) : self
constructors.args_html: (sample_rate : UInt32, sample_size : UInt32, channels : UInt32) : self

def.name: load
def.body:
handle = LibRaudio.load_audio_stream(sample_rate, sample_size, channels)
if ready?(handle)
else
  raise(AudioStreamError.new("Failed to load audio stream"))
end
new(handle)

instance_methods.name: attach_processor
instance_methods.doc: Attach audio stream processor to stream

def.name: attach_processor
def.body:
if released?
  raise(ReleasedError.new)
end
LibRaudio.attach_audio_stream_processor(@handle, processor)
if @processors.includes?(processor)
else
  @processors << processor
end

def.name: callback=
def.body:
if released?
  raise(ReleasedError.new)
end
@stream_callback = cb
LibRaudio.set_audio_stream_callback(@handle, cb)

def.name: clear_callback
def.body:
if released?
  raise(ReleasedError.new)
end
@stream_callback = nil
LibRaudio.set_audio_stream_callback(@handle, NOOP_CALLBACK)

instance_methods.name: detach_processor
instance_methods.doc: Detach audio stream processor from stream

instance_methods.name: pan=
instance_methods.doc: Set pan for audio stream (0.5 is center)
instance_methods.summary: Set pan for audio stream (0.5 is center)

def.name: pan=
def.body:
if released?
  raise(ReleasedError.new)
end
LibRaudio.set_audio_stream_pan(@handle, pan)

instance_methods.name: pitch=
instance_methods.doc: Set pitch for audio stream (1.0 is base level)
instance_methods.summary: Set pitch for audio stream (1.0 is base level)

def.name: pitch=
def.body:
if released?
  raise(ReleasedError.new)
end
LibRaudio.set_audio_stream_pitch(@handle, pitch)

instance_methods.name: playing?
instance_methods.doc: Check if audio stream is playing

instance_methods.name: processed?
instance_methods.doc: Check if any audio stream buffers requires refill
instance_methods.summary: Check if any audio stream buffers requires refill

instance_methods.name: ready?
instance_methods.doc: Check if this audio stream is ready
instance_methods.summary: Check if this audio stream is ready

def.name: release
def.body:
if @released
  return
end

@processors.each do |p|
  LibRaudio.detach_audio_stream_processor(@handle, p)
end
if cb = @stream_callback
  LibRaudio.set_audio_stream_callback(@handle, NOOP_CALLBACK)
  @stream_callback = nil
end
LibRaudio.unload_audio_stream(@handle)
@released = true

instance_methods.name: update
instance_methods.doc: Update audio stream buffers with data

def.name: update
def.body:
if released?
  raise(ReleasedError.new)
end
LibRaudio.update_audio_stream(@handle, data, frame_count)

instance_methods.name: volume=
instance_methods.doc: Set volume for audio stream (1.0 is max level)
instance_methods.summary: Set volume for audio stream (1.0 is max level)

types.doc: Generic load error with optional path

constructors.args_html: (message = "Load error", path : String | Nil = nil)

types.name: Music
types.doc:
Music represents a streaming audio source
Use this for long audio tracks (background music, etc.)
Music is streamed in chunks to save memory
types.summary: Music represents a streaming audio source Use this for long audio tracks (background music, etc.) Music is streamed in chunks to save memory

def.name: load
def.body:
music = load(filename)
begin
  yield music
ensure
  music.release
end

class_methods.name: ready?
class_methods.doc: Check if music stream is ready

constructors.name: from_memory
constructors.doc: Load music stream from memory data

def.name: from_memory
def.body:
handle = LibRaudio.load_music_stream_from_memory(file_type, data, data.size)
if ready?(handle)
else
  raise(MusicLoadError.new("Failed to load music from memory"))
end
new(handle)

constructors.name: load
constructors.doc:
Load music stream from file
Supported formats: WAV, OGG, MP3, FLAC, XM, MOD, QOA
constructors.summary: Load music stream from file Supported formats: WAV, OGG, MP3, FLAC, XM, MOD, QOA

def.name: load
def.body:
handle = LibRaudio.load_music_stream(filename.to_s)
if ready?(handle)
else
  raise(MusicLoadError.new("Failed to load music", filename.to_s))
end
new(handle)

Set whether the music should loop when it reaches the end

Note: Changes take effect when `play` is called.
To change looping for already playing music, stop and restart it.

LibRaudio.seek_music_stream(@handle, position)

Sound represents a short audio clip loaded in memory
Use this for sound effects and short audio samples

handle = LibRaudio.load_sound_from_wave(wave.to_unsafe)
if ready?(handle)
else

new(handle)

instance_methods.doc: Check if sound is currently playing

instance_methods.name: ready?
instance_methods.doc: Check if this sound is ready

def.name: release
def.body:
if @released
  return
end
if @alias
  LibRaudio.unload_sound_alias(@handle)
else
  LibRaudio.unload_sound(@handle)
end
@released = true

instance_methods.doc: Update sound buffer with new data

def.name: update
def.body:
if released?
  raise(ReleasedError.new)
end
LibRaudio.update_sound(@handle, data, sample_count)

types.name: Wave
types.doc:
Wave represents raw audio data
Use this for loading and manipulating audio waveforms
types.summary: Wave represents raw audio data Use this for loading and manipulating audio waveforms

def.name: load
def.body:
wave = load(filename)
begin
  yield wave
ensure
  wave.release
end

class_methods.name: ready?
class_methods.doc: Check if wave data is ready

class_methods.name: unload_samples
class_methods.doc:
Unload wave samples data
Only call this on samples returned by `load_samples`
class_methods.summary: Unload wave samples data Only call this on samples returned by #load_samples

constructors.name: load
constructors.doc:
Load wave data from file
Supported formats: WAV, OGG, MP3, FLAC, QOA
constructors.summary: Load wave data from file Supported formats: WAV, OGG, MP3, FLAC, QOA

def.name: load
def.body:
handle = LibRaudio.load_wave(filename.to_s)
if ready?(handle)
else
  raise(WaveLoadError.new("Failed to load wave", filename.to_s))
end
new(handle)

def.name: load_from_memory
def.body:
handle = LibRaudio.load_wave_from_memory(file_type, data, data.size)
if ready?(handle)
else
  raise(WaveLoadError.new("Failed to load wave from memory"))
end
new(handle)

def.name: copy
def.body:
if released?
  raise(ReleasedError.new)
end
handle = LibRaudio.wave_copy(@handle)
Wave.new(handle)

instance_methods.name: crop
instance_methods.doc: Crop wave data to specified samples range
instance_methods.summary: Crop wave data to specified samples range

def.name: crop
def.body:
if released?
  raise(ReleasedError.new)
end
LibRaudio.wave_crop(pointerof(@handle), init_sample, final_sample)

def.name: export
def.body:
if released?
  raise(ReleasedError.new)
end
LibRaudio.export_wave(@handle, filename)

def.name: export_as_code
def.body:
if released?
  raise(ReleasedError.new)
end
LibRaudio.export_wave_as_code(@handle, filename)

instance_methods.name: format
instance_methods.doc: Convert wave data to desired format

def.name: format
def.body:
if released?
  raise(ReleasedError.new)
end
LibRaudio.wave_format(pointerof(@handle), sample_rate, sample_size, channels)

instance_methods.name: load_samples
instance_methods.doc:
Load wave samples as a floats array
Returns a Slice of Float32 containing the sample data
Note: You must manually call `unload_samples` on the returned pointer when done
instance_methods.summary: Load wave samples as a floats array Returns a Slice of Float32 containing the sample data Note: You must manually call .unload_samples on the returned pointer when done

def.name: load_samples
def.body:
if released?
  raise(ReleasedError.new)
end
ptr = LibRaudio.load_wave_samples(@handle)

sample_count = @handle.frame_count * @handle.channels
Slice.new(ptr, sample_count)

instance_methods.doc: Check if this wave is ready
